topic.title: HP Helion OpenStack Carrier Grade 2.1: Creating a Cloud Definition with the HCG Dashboard

body.p: The HCG Dashboard is a cloud management tool that allows users to define, deploy, manage, and monitor a HP Helion OpenStack cloud. The tool helps you provide and validate the cloud definitions required to deploy your cloud and guide you through the deployment.
Use the Create New Cloud Definition link to open the Input for Cloud table to specify the Standard Region details for the HP Helion Carrier Grade Cloud you are deploying.

section.title: Create the cloud definition

ol.li: Click the Create New Cloud Definition link.

On the Step 1 table, specify a name for the cloud.
Note: No special characters or spaces allowed;

Specify if you are using HPE StoreVirtual VSA (VSA) and/or HPE StoreServ (3PAR) storage.
You can incorporate back-end drivers to enable management of the OpenStack Block Storage volumes on VSA and/or 3PAR storage arrays. The HPE Block Storage (Cinder) service allows you to configure multiple storage back-ends.

On the Step 2 table, specify the Standard Region servers and map the servers to the controllers.
Enter the IP address, user name, and password for the lifecycle manager host in the Standard Region Hosts fields.
Click the plus icon to add the server. The HCG Dashboard verifies the information and adds the Standard Region controllers to the Assign Standard Region Nodes to Hosts fields.
For each controller in the the Assign Standard Region Nodes to Hosts fields, click the plus icon to add the nodes.

On the Step 3 table, modify the network information for all required networks (CLM, API, BLS). the fields are pre-filled, based on the values you entered in the group_vars/all file, or from a previous deploy of this definition. If you are using untagged networks, enter -1 for segment ID.
On the Step 4 table, view the validation information.

On the Step 5 table enter the network information:
Standard Region
DNS
NTP
SSL
KVM Region
Storage sizes
LAG information
Network IPs
License file information
VLAN mappings
On the Step 6 table, view the validation results for the DNS Server IP and NTP Server IP.
Click Finish to save all data in JSON files that will be used during the deployment.

section.p: After you enter all necessary information for your cloud, you will be redirected to a page where you can see a description and current status of your cloud as it deploys.
